headline: Retail earnings: Consumers are spending on needs, not wants
summary: Retailers are in focus following Target's (TGT), Home Depot's (HD), and TJ Maxx parent company TJX's (TJX) earnings results, while investors await Walmart's (WMT) earnings results out Thursday morning. Placer.ai head of analytical research R.J. Hottovy shares his takeaways from retail earnings so far and what they signal about the health of the consumer. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Ekes Out Gain; Nasdaq Comes Off Lows While Palantir Retakes Key Level After 15% Plunge
summary: Other major indexes remained in the red in a session where investors saw division amongst monetary policymakers in the minutes of the Federal Reserve's July meeting.  Several retail stocks moved on earnings, while Palantir Technologies managed to retake a key level on the stock market today after falling more than 15%.  Meanwhile, investors awaited a speech from Fed Chairman Jerome Powell.

content.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Ekes Out Gain; Nasdaq Comes Off Lows While Palantir Retakes Key Level After 15% Plunge
content.summary: Other major indexes remained in the red in a session where investors saw division amongst monetary policymakers in the minutes of the Federal Reserve's July meeting.  Several retail stocks moved on earnings, while Palantir Technologies managed to retake a key level on the stock market today after falling more than 15%.  Meanwhile, investors awaited a speech from Fed Chairman Jerome Powell.

headline: Lowe's (LOW) Q2 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Marvin Ellison: Thank you, Kate, and good morning, everyone.  This morning, we announced the acquisition of Foundation Building Materials or FBM, a premier distributor of interior building products including drywall, metal framing, ceiling systems, insulation, commercial doors, and hardware, and other complementary products.  This acquisition represents a transformational move when it comes to advancing our total home strategy and enhancing long-term shareholder value.

content.title: Lowe's (LOW) Q2 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
content.summary: Marvin Ellison: Thank you, Kate, and good morning, everyone.  This morning, we announced the acquisition of Foundation Building Materials or FBM, a premier distributor of interior building products including drywall, metal framing, ceiling systems, insulation, commercial doors, and hardware, and other complementary products.  This acquisition represents a transformational move when it comes to advancing our total home strategy and enhancing long-term shareholder value.

headline: Lowe's Raises Outlook, Expands Pro Reach With $8.8 Billion Acquisition
summary: Lowe’s Companies, Inc. (NYSE:LOW) reported second-quarter net earnings of $2.4 billion, or diluted Earnings Per Share (EPS) of $4.27, compared to $4.17 in the year-ago quarter. Adjusted diluted EPS rose 5.6% to $4.33 from $4.10, topping analyst estimates of $4.24. Quarterly sales reached $23.96 billion, compared with $23.59 billion a year earlier, and came in slightly above Wall Street’s estimate of $23.96 billion. Comparable sales increased 1.1%. headline: Lowe's buying Foundation Building Materials for about $8.8B as it intensifies focus on pro builders
summary: Lowe's is buying Foundation Building Materials, a distributor of drywall, insulation and other products, for approximately $8.8 billion as the home improvement retailer intensifies its focus on professional builders.  FBM also provides metal framing, ceiling systems, commercial doors and hardware and other products that serve large residential and commercial professionals in both new construction and repair and remodel applications.  The acquisition is part of Lowe's move to provide more options for professional builders.

content.title: Lowe's buying Foundation Building Materials for about $8.8B as it intensifies focus on pro builders
content.summary: Lowe's is buying Foundation Building Materials, a distributor of drywall, insulation and other products, for approximately $8.8 billion as the home improvement retailer intensifies its focus on professional builders.  FBM also provides metal framing, ceiling systems, commercial doors and hardware and other products that serve large residential and commercial professionals in both new construction and repair and remodel applications.  The acquisition is part of Lowe's move to provide more options for professional builders.

headline: Foundation Building Materials, Building Products Distribution Company Owned By American Securities and CD&R, To Be Sold To Lowe's In $8.8 Billion Transaction
summary: American Securities LLC ("American Securities") and CD&R today announced they have entered into a definitive agreement to sell Foundation Building Materials, Inc. ("FBM" or the "Company") to Lowe's Companies, Inc. ("Lowe's") (NYSE: LOW) for $8.8 billion.

content.title: Foundation Building Materials, Building Products Distribution Company Owned By American Securities and CD&R, To Be Sold To Lowe's In $8.8 Billion Transaction
content.summary: American Securities LLC ("American Securities") and CD&R today announced they have entered into a definitive agreement to sell Foundation Building Materials, Inc. ("FBM" or the "Company") to Lowe's Companies, Inc. ("Lowe's") (NYSE: LOW) for $8.8 billion.

headline: Lowe's (NYSE:LOW) Posts Q2 Sales In Line With Estimates
summary: Home improvement retailer Lowe’s (NYSE:LOW) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 1.6% year on year to $23.96 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $85 billion at the midpoint came in 0.7% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.33 per share was 2.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Lowe's (NYSE:LOW) Posts Q2 Sales In Line With Estimates
content.summary: Home improvement retailer Lowe’s (NYSE:LOW) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 1.6% year on year to $23.96 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $85 billion at the midpoint came in 0.7% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.33 per share was 2.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Lowe's to buy Foundation Building Materials for $8.8 billion to boost contractor business
summary: (Reuters) -Lowe's Cos said on Wednesday it has agreed to buy interior building products distributor Foundation Building Materials for nearly $8.8 billion, stepping up its expansion into the business that serves contractors and builders.  Shares of the home improvement chain rose 2% to $261.70 in early trading as the company also raised annual sales forecast and beat second-quarter profit estimates.  Lowe's and rival Home Depot are turning to deals to bolster their presence in the $250 billion worth professional builder market, amid weak demand in the do-it-yourself category.

content.title: Lowe's to buy Foundation Building Materials for $8.8 billion to boost contractor business
content.summary: (Reuters) -Lowe's Cos said on Wednesday it has agreed to buy interior building products distributor Foundation Building Materials for nearly $8.8 billion, stepping up its expansion into the business that serves contractors and builders.  Shares of the home improvement chain rose 2% to $261.70 in early trading as the company also raised annual sales forecast and beat second-quarter profit estimates.  Lowe's and rival Home Depot are turning to deals to bolster their presence in the $250 billion worth professional builder market, amid weak demand in the do-it-yourself category.
